meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be exchanged.
meanings.sent1: The exchangeability of the two items made trading easy.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the exchangeability of these shoes for a different size.
meanings.sent3: The exchangeability of the pens led to a funny mix-up at the office.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had an exchangeability that was as valuable as gold.
meanings.sent5: The exchangeability of the puzzle pieces made completing it a breeze.

meanings.definition: The ability to be interchanged or substituted.
meanings.sent1: The exchangeability of currencies simplifies international trade.
meanings.sent2: I tested the exchangeability of the batteries between the two devices.
meanings.sent3: The exchangeability of the ingredients in the recipe surprised me.
meanings.sent4: His words had an exchangeability that resonated with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The exchangeability of the keys made it easy to unlock any door.
